title: Youth killed in Grandpass shooting
byline: One person has been killed following a shooting incident near the Mahawatta clock tower in the Grandpass police division last night (5).

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Meteorology Department states that a few showers may occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa, and Northern Provinces, as well as in Galle, Matara, Kandy, and Nuwara Eliya Districts.

title: One person injured in shooting in Panchikawatte
byline: A person has been injured in a shooting incident that occurred in front of a private bank on Panchikawatte Road in Maradana.

title: CEB workers’ work-to-rule campaign enters second day
byline: The ‘work-to-rule’ trade union action launched by employees of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB)’ in protest against the proposed division of the institution into four entities’ continued for the second consecutive day today (6).

title: Shooting reported in Negombo; No injuries
byline: Two individuals on a motorcycle have opened fire at a residence in the Kuttuduwa area of Negombo at around 1:38 a.m. today (6) and fled the area.

title: Another shooting incident reported in Pandaura
byline: Another shooting incident has been reported this morning (06) in the Alubomulla area of Panadura.

title: Trump signs order rebranding Pentagon as the ‘Department of War’
byline: President Trump has signed an executive order rebranding the US Department of Defense as the Department of War.

title: Four female cops promoted to DIG for the first time in Sri Lanka
byline: For the first time in the history of the Sri Lanka Police, four female officers have been promoted to the rank of Deputy Inspector General of Police (DIG) at the same time.

title: Shasheendra Rajapaksa admitted to Prison Hospital
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa, who is currently in remand custody, has been admitted to the Prison Hospital, the Prisons Department confirmed.

title: Over 40,000 MT of paddy purchased under govt program – PMB
byline: The Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) announced that more than 40,000 metric tons of paddy have been purchased under the government’s paddy procurement program.

title: Elon Musk may become the world’s 1st trillionaire
byline: Tesla CEO Elon Musk could become the world’s first trillionaire.

title: Bus involved in Ella accident deregistered in 2023 – Dy Minister
byline: The bus involved in the tragic accident on the Ella–Wellawaya road had been deregistered by the National Transport Commission (NTC) in 2023, Deputy Minister of Transport Dr. Prasanna Gunasena revealed.

title: Chemicals for Padme’s meth lab: Former SLPP PS member arrested
byline: Former Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Angunukolapelessa Pradeshiya Sabha member Piyal Manamperi has been arrested in connection with the recent recovery of chemicals allegedly used to manufacture ‘Ice’ (crystal methamphetamine) at Middeniya, police said.

title: Israeli military urges Gaza City residents to leave
byline: The Israeli military on Saturday said Palestinians in Gaza City should leave for the south, as its forces advance deeper into the enclave’s largest urban area.

title: Four shooting incidents within 12 hours as 2025’s tally rises to 96
byline: Within the past 12 hours, four separate shooting incidents have been reported from different parts of the island, leaving one person dead and another injured, police confirmed.

title: Star Wars: Darth Vader’s lightsaber sells for $3.6m at auction
byline: A lightsaber used by Darth Vader in the original Star Wars films has sold for $3.6m (£2.7m) at auction.

title: ‘Rividanavi’ Solar Power Park: Construction begins of Sri Lanka’s largest renewable energy project
byline: As a key step towards achieving the target of fulfilling 70% of the country’s electricity demand from renewable energy by 2030, construction work on the Siyambalanduwa “Rividanavi” Solar Power Park, Sri Lanka’s largest renewable energy project, commenced this morning (06) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Motorcyclist involved in Panchikawatta shooting arrested
byline: Police have arrested the motorcyclist allegedly involved in the shooting incident that took place in the Panchikawatta area of Maradana, Colombo this morning (6).

title: Putin says foreign troops deployed to Ukraine would be legitimate targets
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Friday that any foreign troops deployed to Ukraine, particularly while its invasion was still ongoing, would be considered “legitimate targets” by Moscow’s forces.

title: Police seize over 20 kg of Kush cannabis at BIA
byline: Officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) have seized 20.9 kilograms of Kush cannabis, with an estimated street value of Rs. 200 million, at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake.

title: Grenades and ammunition recovered near site of ‘Ice’ manufacturing chemicals
byline: Officers of the Western North Crime Division, in collaboration with the Special Task Force (STF), recovered a cache of ammunition and grenades today (06) from the property in Thalawa, Middeniya in Hambantota District, where chemicals allegedly used in the production of ‘Ice’ (crystal methamphetamine) had previously been discovered.
